result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Anthony Shane Lindem

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Anthony Shane Lindem not in court.  Attorney Dean Douglas Sopcic in court for Anthony Shane Lindem.  Prosecuting attorney Navjot Singh Hira in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
CASE HEARD OFF THE RECORD DUE TO COURT REPORTER AVAILABILITY.
Case in court for pretrial conference. State is in compliance with victim notification. Court waives defendant's appearance.
Defense counsel has received discovery and offer and requests additional time to review.
Case adjourned to Branch 15.
Status conference scheduled for December 1, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
No Contact Order signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3. Court ordered Defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY. Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription. No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with LG (08/27/1967).

Defendant Anthony Shane Lindem appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Vincent Paul Guimont appeared by video for Anthony Shane Lindem.  Prosecuting attorney Michael J. Odden appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge J.D. Watts, Branch 15.   Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned to Branch 15 for pretrial conference.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
